TestDescription.name: Liferay JSON service API authentication vulnerability
TestDescription.Description: The Liferay JSON implementation do not check if a user that call a method on a serviceClass is disabled. Usually the default administrator user, test@liferay.com, is used to create a new administrator and disabled without to change the default password, so it is possible to use it to execute JSON API calls.
TestDescription.Impact:
An attacker could exploit the vulnerability to become administrator and retrieve or publish any kind of data on Liferay.
It is also possible to inject a web command shell on the Liferay machine.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest version of Liferay.

Reference.database: Liferay JSON service API authentication vulnerability
